column1: Section  110  (3)  of  the  Cri.P.C.  states  that  a  statement  made  by  any  person  to  a  Police
Officer in the course of any investigation may be used in accordance with the provisions
of the Evidence Ordinance except for the purpose of corroborating the testimony of such
person in court. The proviso states that a statement made by an accused person in the
course of any investigation shall only be used to prove that he made a different statement
at a different time. The 1st Respondent is not an accused person as no charges have been
Moreover, the Cri.P.C. is according to its preamble an Act to regulate the procedure of the
Criminal Courts. This an application made in terms of Article 140 of the Constitution.
Section 25 (1) of the Evidence Ordinance prohibits a confession made to a Police Officer
from being proved as against a person accused of any offence. This has no application to
the 1st Respondent as she is yet to be charged for any offence.
